author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 48-year-old mason was killed on the spot, and his assistant severely injured, when a speeding tempo traveller crashed into their bike on Sumanahalli flyover on Sunday afternoon.

The deceased has been identified as Mahadevaiah. The assistant, Muniswamy (31), had a miraculous escape as he managed to jump off the moving motorcycle in the nick of time.

According to the police, the incident occurred around 1.15 p.m. when Mahadevaiah, who had gone to Kunigal for some work, was returning to his house in Hongasandra.

The driver of the tempo traveller is said to have lost control while overtaking a car and rammed into the divider.

On impact, the vehicle turned turtle and crashed into Mahadevaiah’s motorcycle on the other side of the road. The tempo traveller driver fled as passers-by gathered and alerted the traffic police.

Mahadevaiah’s body and the crushed motorcycle were found when a crane pulled the truck up.

Traffic in and around the flyover was disrupted for over an hour.

The Kamakshipalya police have registered a hit-and-run case and efforts are on to nab the driver.
title: Tempo hits divider, overturns, rams bike, kills rider
